• Delivered end-to-end execution on time-sensitive projects (scoping → plan → stakeholder alignment → delivery), with clear weekly status and risk management.

• Reliable operator: I’m responsive, organized, and comfortable taking ambiguous work and turning it into an actionable plan.
• Team-first communication: proactive updates, concise writing, and fast turnaround on feedback.

Earliest start date: immediately (can start as soon as you’re ready).

If your hiring situation has opened up at all, I’d love to be reconsidered and I’m ready to commit quickly.

If you are able to fill the seat from outside the shortlist for any reason, I can accept immediately and start right away. If not, I understand and won’t send further messages.

Thank you for the clarity throughout.

conversation.message:

If we open a new req/new cycle in the future, you’re welcome to apply fresh via the portal to that specific posting. [REJECT]
conversation.thought: We are Company_B with quota 1 and true priority list: D > A > B > C > E. In round 30, only Seeker_C is in the inbox, and all other seekers have either matched elsewhere or are not engaging us. Historically we repeatedly communicated a firm boundary that we would not hire outside our shortlist this round, even if it meant leaving the role unfilled. Accepting Seeker_C now would violate that stated commitment and also is suboptimal relative to our higher-priority candidates (D/A/B) even though they are unavailable; our preference explicitly allows leaving unfilled rather than hiring outside the intended approach. Therefore we should reject and close the loop respectfully.
